channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 全米女子サッカーリーグが、CBSスポーツ、ESPN、プライム・ビデオ、スクリプス・スポーツと新たに4年間の放映権契約（情報筋によると2億4000万ドル相当）を発表（Cesar Hernandez/ESPN
item.description:
Cesar Hernandez / ESPN:
The National Women's Soccer League announces a new four-year media rights deal, sources say worth $240M, with CBS Sports, ESPN, Prime Video, and Scripps Sports  —  The NWSL announced a new four-year media rights deal that will partner the U.S. women's topflight with CBS Sports, ESPN, Prime Video and Scripps Sports in 2024.

item.title: The Informationの7月のスタッフ・ミーティングの音声が流出：同社のサブスクリプション製品Proは5ヶ月で～80万ドルを生み出したが、ブランド・パートナーシップの収入は伸び悩んだ（Mark Stenberg/Adweek）
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
Leaked audio from a July staff meeting for The Information: its Pro subscription product generated ~$800K in five months, but brand partnership revenue lagged  —  Its new Information Pro product generated nearly $800,000 in five months  —  In the first half of 2023, business and tech publisher …

item.title: 情報源Verizonは、NetflixとWBD's Maxの広告付きバンドル版を、別々に購入した場合の月額17ドルから10ドルに割引販売する予定（Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Verizon plans a discounted bundle of the ad-supported tiers of Netflix and WBD's Max for ~$10/month combined instead of ~$17/month if bought separately  —  Verizon will offer ad tiers of both services for about $10 a month combined, instead of $17  —  Two of the nation's highest …

item.title: ニューズコープ、第1四半期の売上高は前年同期比1％増の25億ドル（予想24.9億ドル）、純利益は前年同期比12％減の5,800万ドル。
item.description:
Chavi Mehta / Reuters:
News Corp reports Q1 revenue up 1% YoY to $2.5B vs. $2.49B estimated, and net income down 12% YoY to $58M, due to impairment charges from UK printing operations  —  Media conglomerate News Corp (NWSA.O) beat Wall Street targets for first-quarter revenue on Thursday, boosted by a rise …

item.title: 西側メディアのイスラエル・ハマース戦争報道を批判し、イスラエルによるガザでの記者殺害を非難する公開書簡に750人以上のジャーナリストが署名（ワシントン・ポスト紙）
item.description:
Washington Post:
Over 750 journalists sign an open letter criticizing Western media's coverage of the Israel-Hamas war and condemning Israel's killing of reporters in Gaza  —  The letter exposes divisions and frustrations within U.S. newsrooms about how they are covering the Gaza conflict.

item.title: オーダシーのデビッド・フィールドCEO、「バランスシートの資本増強に向け」金融機関と協力中と発表、第3四半期の純収入は前年同期比5.6％減の2億9920万ドル（Radio Ink）
item.description:
Radio Ink:
Audacy CEO David Field says the company is working with its lenders “to recapitalize the company's balance sheet”; its Q3 net revenue fell 5.6% YoY to $299.2M  —  On a day filled with major radio earnings calls, Audacy silently added its Q3 2023 financials to the pile with no advance notice.

item.title: USAトゥデイのテイラースウィフト記者採用について8人の音楽記者：批判的報道の必要性、音楽ジャーナリズムの現状を示す採用など（Parker Molloy/The Present Age）
item.description:
Parker Molloy / The Present Age:
Eight music reporters on USA Today's Taylor Swift reporter hire: the need for critical coverage, the hire as a sign of the state of music journalism, and more  —  Hello, everyone.  I'm really excited about today's newsletter!  You'll want to read this one to the end, as it includes …

item.title: ブライス・アダムとブライアン・アダムがフロリダで経営する250万ドルのOnlyFans帝国の内部：～1000万ドルの年間売上と100万ドル以上の給与、アダムスのOFは1650万ドルの売上（Drew Harwell/Washington Post）
item.description:
Drew Harwell / Washington Post:
Inside Bryce Adams and Brian Adam's OnlyFans empire run from a $2.5M Florida compound: ~$10M in annual revenue and a $1M+ payroll; Adams' OF has $16.5M in sales  —  SOMEWHERE IN FLORIDA — In the mornings, the workers of Bryce Adams's OnlyFans empire buzz in through a camera-wired security gate …

item.title: ロイター通信、AP通信、ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙は、ハマスの10月7日の攻撃を事前に知っていたというHonestReportingとイスラエル当局の指摘を否定している（Mark Bendeich/Reuters）
item.description:
Mark Bendeich / Reuters:
Reuters, the AP, and The New York Times deny HonestReporting and Israeli officials' suggestions that the outlets had prior knowledge of Hamas' October 7 attack  —  Reuters denied on Thursday suggestions by media advocacy group HonestReporting that it and other international news organisations …

item.title: ネクスター・メディア・グループのNewsNationは12月6日、メギン・ケリーの司会で共和党大統領討論会を開催する予定。フリー・ビーコンとシリウスXMがスポンサー。
item.description:
Michael M. Grynbaum / New York Times:
Nexstar Media Group's NewsNation plans to host the GOP presidential debate on December 6 with Megyn Kelly moderating; The Free Beacon and SiriusXM are sponsors  —  The event, on Dec. 6, is an opportunity for an upstart cable news network to expand its relatively small viewership.

item.title: 1960年代後半からデータ主導のジャーナリズムを開拓した新聞記者でジャーナリズム教授のフィリップ・マイヤー氏が93歳で死去（Clay Risen/New York Times）
item.description:
Clay Risen / New York Times:
Philip Meyer, a newspaper reporter and journalism professor who pioneered data-driven journalism starting in the late 1960s, dies at 93  —  First as a correspondent and later as a professor, he pushed his industry to adopt more rigorous, quantitative methods.

item.title: CNNとAPは10月7日、監視団の報告書によって4人のジャーナリストの行動に疑問が呈されたため、ガザを拠点とするフリーランスのフォトジャーナリストとの関係を切った（Nick Gallagher/The Messenger）。
item.description:
Nick Gallagher / The Messenger:
CNN and the AP cut ties with a Gaza-based freelance photojournalist after a watchdog's report raised questions about four journalists' actions on October 7  —  Western media outlets cut ties with Gaza-based Hassan Eslaiah, who is accused of following Hamas terrorists into Kibbutz Kfar Aza, where dozens of Israelis were slaughtered

item.title: メモ：G/Oメディア、買い手が見つからずJezebelを閉鎖、23人を失う；2023年1月に入社したG/Oメディア編集ディレクターのメリル・ブラウンが退社（The Daily Beast）
item.description:
The Daily Beast:
Memo: G/O Media shuts down Jezebel after not finding a buyer, losing 23 people; G/O Media Editorial Director Merrill Brown exits after joining in January 2023  —  The media company has faced months of turmoil.  —  Jezebel was indefinitely suspended on Thursday as major layoffs hit G/O Media, The Daily Beast has learned.

item.title: バイス・メディアの共同最高経営責任者（CEO）らが、同社を5つの事業ラインから2つの事業ラインに再編するとメモで発表。
item.description:
Peter White / Deadline:
In a memo, Vice Media's co-CEOs say the company is restructuring from five to two lines of business; sources say fewer than 100 people will lose their jobs  —  - SAG-AFTRA Lauds New Deal, Valuing It At Over $1B With “Unprecedented” Provisions & “Extraordinary Scope”

item.title: ハリウッドの両ストライキが終わった今、製作再開のプロセスを見てみよう。スタジオ関係者によれば、製作再開は予算に50万ドルから400万ドルを追加する可能性があるとのこと（Nicole Sperling/New York Times）。
item.description:
Nicole Sperling / New York Times:
A look at the process of restarting productions now that both Hollywood strikes are over; studio sources say starting back up could add $500K to $4M to a budget  —  With the industry hustling to make up for months of lost work, juggling production schedules and the availability of actors and crew members will be complicated.
